bug.author: Tomcli
bug.summary: testing/kfctl/kfctl_go_test.py is not up to date
bug.description:
/kind bug
[A clear and concise description of what the bug is.] The function is updated in the PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/4493>#4493</denchmark-link> . However, the test is not update with the latest changes which is failing some CI tests (e.g. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/622>kubeflow/manifests#622</denchmark-link> ) under kubeflow/manifest. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/master/testing/kfctl/kfctl_go_test.py#L38>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/master/testing/kfctl/kfctl_go_test.py#L38</denchmark-link>
What did you expect to happen: The CI presubmit shouldn't block by the kfctl_go_test.py with missing arguments. Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): master kfctl version: (use kfctl version): Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube) Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
